Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "binding with a not exist method should be an error, not warn." (#7083) at vuejs/vue
Events.RelatedBody:
### Version
2.5.5

### Reproduction link
[https://jsbin.com/fihinimuxe/1/edit?html,js,console,output](https://jsbin.com/fihinimuxe/1/edit?html,js,console,output)

### Steps to reproduce
element binding with a not exist method

### What is expected?
show `[vue error]`

### What is actually happening?
show `[vue warn]`

---
warn means it can be ignored, but actually it break vue and affect other dom.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Make "component" a required property for a route" (#1892) at vuejs/vue-router
Events.RelatedBody:
### What problem does this feature solve?
It improves the developer experience. Currently if a developer omits or misspells the component key of a route object `({ path: '/foo', Component: FooComponent })` Notice the Capital letter in Component.

No warning is shown (A blank page would be rendered since the path has no Component defined on it), There's already a warning if a developer tries to use a String as a Component. I believe this would also be useful as there's no point having a route that doesn't point to any Component.

### What does the proposed API look like?
There's no change to the API.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
